name: places/ChIJTTkWI7xYwokR2zBGAs58TT4
adrFormatAddress: 1459 3rd Ave #4F, New York, NY 10028-1916, USA

originalText.text:
The ridiculous late policy is so NOT yogi. I was 2 min late and was not allowed into class. I have attended many yoga classes and even y7 yoga in LA and there was someone who was a minute late; and they let them into class.

It’s also the attitudes at the front desk that did it for me. This is supposed to be a good yoga community, and I find them to be anything less than.

There should be a 3 min grace period given to people - it’s NYC!!! And if not, have pleasant people working at the desk of a yoga studio. This is not a nightclub.

Things have changed at y7 since Covid. Even the caliber of teachers have changed.

originalText.text:
I used to love this studio and have been going to y7 for years. Sadly, I feel like the customer service has declined. The receptionist gave my seat to someone else who was on standby before the class even began.

Another woman and I had the last two spots and she said she gave one seat away too early, and whoever came out of the elevator first could get the spot (so bizarre). Even though she said she would return credits or try to get me into the next class, because I am not a y7 member, she said she couldn’t do anything and told me to have a good day.

This was my first experience at y7 UES in a while and I was extremely frustrated and disappointed after driving 20 miles to the studio. It was a complete waste of my time with no repair on Y7’s end. I emailed customer service right away to avoid writing this review and giving another shot, but I got no reply. Truly upsetting for a once great studio.

originalText.text: I have been going to y7 for a few years now on and off and the UES location has been my go to location. It never disappoints the staff is great, the studio is very clean, and the instructors are amazing! I always leave in such a great mood and feeling great about myself. I definitely would recommend!

It never disappoints the staff is great, the studio is very clean, and the instructors are amazing! I always leave in such a great mood and feeling great about myself. I definitely would recommend!

originalText.text:
I once enjoyed it, especially during the winter. However, not a place if you are looking for a yoga community/emotional/spiritual connection/welcome.

***ALWAYS make sure you read the contracts(often you won’t be receiving them though) Make sure you know their cancellation or late policy, their membership.

I have been charged for a monthly membership of $200 for the last 12 months.(They refunded 6 months charge after emailing back and forth for weeks)

I have never received an initial contract or monthly reminder, or any receipt. Which I believe is a violation of NY state merchant law. However, this is my fault that I didn’t make sure I cancelled it but personally felt  little shady tbh.

originalText.text: Ridiculous late policy, I was 5 minutes late because the subway was delayed and they simply didn’t let me come in or offered me an alternative. If you don’t live walking distance from this place, don’t come. You’ll waste your money and time if something happens when you’re commuting. I wish I could give 0 stars, this is not how you embrace new customers
